title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 r. 202.70.9-b - Referees
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 r. 202.70.9-b - Referees

State Regulations

Counsel should be aware that in accordance with CPLR 4301
and 4317(a), on consent of the parties, and with the agreement of the Court, any person may be appointed by the Court to act in place of the assigned

Supreme Court Justice, to determine any or all issues or to perform any act, with all the powers of the Supreme Court. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
r. 202.70.9-b

Adopted
eff. 2/14/2024. Adopted

New

York State Register March 13, 2024/Volume XLVI, Issue 11, eff. 3/13/2024

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
